<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a></>}>
This class is used to track the amount of time spent between invocations of its <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer/#aa8c887576ec3b0d68c10ebf4097c367c">startTimer()</a>/stopTimer() methods. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timeregion">TimeRegion</a></>}>
The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timeregion">TimeRegion</a> class is used as a helper class to call the startTimer() and stopTimer() methods of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a> class. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timeregion/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/namedregiontimer">NamedRegionTimer</a></>}>
This class is basically a combination of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timeregion">TimeRegion</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a>. <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/namedregiontimer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timergroup">TimerGroup</a></>}>
The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timergroup">TimerGroup</a> class is used to group together related timers into a single report that is printed when the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timergroup">TimerGroup</a> is destroyed. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timergroup/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/timergroup/printrecord">PrintRecord</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class is used to track the amount of time spent between invocations of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">/// its startTimer()/stopTimer() methods.  Given appropriate OS support it can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">/// also keep track of the RSS of the program at various points.  By default,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the Timer will print the amount of time it has captured to standard error</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// when the last timer is destroyed, otherwise it is printed when its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TimerGroup is destroyed.  Timers do not print their information if they are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// never started.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer/#aa625638779b64a2d67808371d6b37e4c">Timer</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timerecord">TimeRecord</a> Time;          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; The total time captured.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timerecord">TimeRecord</a> StartTime;     </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; The time startTimer() was last called.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The TimeRegion class is used as a helper class to call the startTimer() and</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the relevant timer.  This makes it easy to time a region of code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class is basically a combination of TimeRegion and Timer.  It allows</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">/// you to declare a new timer, AND specify the region to time, all in one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">/// statement.  All timers with the same name are merged.  This is primarily</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">/// used for debugging and for hunting performance problems.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/namedregiontimer"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/namedregiontimer/#a49aea1d2b11c5daa73a6581fbaed6508">NamedRegionTimer</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TimeRegion &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The TimerGroup class is used to group together related timers into a single</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">/// report that is printed when the TimerGroup is destroyed.  It is illegal to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="comment">/// destroy a TimerGroup object before all of the Timers in it are gone.  A</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TimerGroup can be specified for a newly created timer in its constructor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timergroup"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">TimerGroup &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
